characters: THE TRESTLE EXPLODES IN A STORM OF SPARKS... ARLINGTON IS
THROWN ONTO HIS BACK... HIS BODY ENGULFED IN FLAMES.
VIKING LANDER SENDS FIRST IMAGES OF RED PLANET BACK TO EA
I SAID BACK AWAY FROM THE DOOR AND
OPEC SAID TO DECIDE ON SPLIT HIKE
BACK AWAY FROM THE DOOR AND PUT
PUT YOUR HANDS ON YOUR HEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMA LEWIS ( 31) sits up in bed. The soft glow of the la casts her in silhouette. Her husband, ARTHUR LEWIS (30), next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure that was the doorbell? From down below... the DOORBELL rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Norma retrieves her WATCH from the bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quarter 'til five. Norma gets out of bed and throws on her bathrobe. Arthur sits up, hair sticking up in every direction. He h sideburns that run down the side of his face like daggers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma comes down the stairs and approaches the front door She looks through the PEEPHOLE. Through the PEEPHOLE... she glimpses a BLACK SEDAN idling the street. It quickly drives off. Norma unlatches the DEAD BOLT and opens the door. She not something at her feet.

Someone has left a CARDBOARD BOX on the front step. It's dimensions are 1' x 1' x 1' She leans down and picks up the box, noticing that it has been meticulously sealed with clear tape. There are no markings on it whatsoever. Norma looks down the quiet, empty street. She quickly clo the door and turns inside and away from the cold air. Arthur arrives at the bottom of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone left a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. There was a car waiting... but they drove off. Norma hands the box to Arthur. He examines it.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that one of my Christmas presents? Their young son, WALTER LEWIS ( 9), is standing at the to the stairs. He is dressed in his pajamas. His parents just stare back at him in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lewis family has now moved into the kitchen. WRAPPING PAPER and CHRISTMAS ORNAMENTS are scattered across the ta Norma is pouring COFFEE. Arthur is cutting through the ta that seals the box with a knife while Walter looks on eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I close my eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe... it's up to you. Arthur opens the lid and sees that there are FOAM PEANUTS inside. He digs down and retrieves a WOODEN BOX. Its dimensions are 8" x 8" x 8".
The box is made of WHITE OAK with a clear varnish. Mounte top is a CLEAR GLASS DOME attached to a lid with a HINGE MOUNT. Inside of the dome is a CYLINDRICAL METAL BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a note? Arthur reaches inside the box and retrieves a small WHITE ENVELOPE. Printed on the envelope in CALLIGRAPHY is the n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for you, Norma. Norma opens the envelope and removes a folded piece of wh stationary. Printed in elegant calligraphy is a single sentence: MR. STEWARD WILL CALL UPON YOU AT 5:00 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Steward will call upon you at 5 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know a Mr. Steward? Arthur yawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. You tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur is now showered and shaven, dressed for work. He a Walter sit at the kitchen table, waiting for Norma to del breakfast. The box sits on the table between them. Arthur opens up the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: OPEC SAID TO DECIDE ON SPLIT HIKE
dialogues.text: Arthur turns the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of car was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't see. It was dark and 1 didn't have my contacts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they just drive off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But the bus will be here if five minutes... so eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Walter emerge from the house onto the front por She hands him his LUNCH BOX and a WINTER HAT. SNOW has be to fall from the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last day of school and now it starts to snow?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on your hat... A young girl, DANA ( 13) is waiting at the end of the sidewalk. She is wrapped head-to-toe in warm clothes... EARMUFFS and SCARF around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled through scarf) Hi Mrs. Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Dana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And please call me Norma. You're making me feel old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thirty-one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To us that's old! You're a geezer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you'll be a geezer one day too, smarty-pants.
Norma closes her eyes, taking in a breath of cold air. Snowflakes land in her face and hair. Walter sighs... looking at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does the bus stop have to be at the end of our driveway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can watch my little Walter get on his bus... safe in one piece! Down the street, A SCHOOL BUS begins to crest the hill... fast approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Go. Inside. You're embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My love embarrasses you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes it does. She begins to walk down the sidewalk... taunting him as t bus approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I give little Walter a little kiss in front of all his friends on the school bus? Dana's eyes widen. A MISCHIEVOUS GRIN emerges from behind scarf that covers the lower part of her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! The bus is fast approaching... brakes squealing as it slo to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't come any closer! Norma gives him a big HUG and a KISS right as the bus doo open. A bunch of OLDER KIDS stare out the window... scowl at him. Walter pushes away from her and stomps up onto the bus... mortified. Dana follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana... you're baby-sitting for us tonight, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Dana gets on the bus. BUD WALL (30s), the bus driver, smi at Norma. He is an enormous giant of a man with a shaved head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus-Driver Bud! Merry Christmas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our last day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll all be over soon, Norma. He stares at her for a moment that is almost too long... shuts the doors to the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits at the table... reading the morning paper. The CAMERA zooms into the COMICS SECTION... revealing the panels of the comic strip REX MORGAN, MD. Arthur begins reading the voices of REX MORGAN and his girlfriend JUNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Rex Morgan) Do you realize that this is the first time in my life that I will be taking more than a week's vacation, June? Norma arrives in the kitchen. She now has a slight limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as June, hi-pitched) And enjoy it! Don't worry about the office!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex Morgan... I need you back here no later than seven. Rehearsal dinner starts at eight. Arthur grabs his BRIEFCASE and a BASKETBALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Viking Squad has a game at four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get stuck in Friday traffic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay June. He starts bouncing the ball on the kitchen floor. She grabs the ball in mid bounce... annoyed with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your foot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. She pushes him toward into the FAMILY ROOM... opening the door that leads out to the garage. They exit the house and the CAMERA drifts back toward the kitchen table... moving in toward the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GARAGE DOOR opens and both of the LEWIS FAMILY CARS b out at the same time, almost choreographed in perfect uni Arthur drives a SILVER 1975 PONTIAC TRANS-AM. Norma drive WHITE 1976 OLDSMOBILE STATION WAGON with WOOD WALLS. They pull out onto MONUMENT AVENUE, cars pointing in oppo directions. Arthur rolls down his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your Christmas present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From your secret lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Steward. She furrows her brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you, Rex Morgan MD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be late tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got your present at work. It's almost finished. He smiles... then peels off down Monument Ave. From Norma's REAR VIEW MIRROR... Arthur's car disappears the road. She reaches up to re-adjust... her eyes appear the mirror's reflection. INSERT: Norma's VIRGINIA license plate. The Oldsmobile drives down the street in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELICOPTER SHOT: The CAMERA crests over the barren WINTER FOREST on the southeast side of the city... tipping up to reveal DOWNTOWN RICHMOND, VIRGINIA.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's twenty-three degrees on this December morning here in Richmond... The CAMERA moves over the DOWNTOWN EXPRESSWAY... heavy traffic moves in either direction. The CAMERA approaches the side of ARTHUR'S TRANS-AM as it crests around the INTERSTATE EXCHANGE onto ROUTE 64 at th HISTORICAL CLOCK TOWER of MAIN STREET TRAIN STATION.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The French government, in what was seen here as a gesture to President- elect Jimmy Carter, announced Thursday a further tightening of controls over the exportation of nuclear technology. The CAMERA swoops down alongside the driver's side of Arthur's car... moving into the SIDE VIEW MIRROR. His fac reflected in the mirror... listening to the radio as he begins his southbound commute to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA pulls back from .a sign at the entrance to COLLEGIATE... an exclusive PRIVATE SCHOOL. Norma's STATIO WAGON pulls into the school parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks with Norma as makes her way through the CROWDED HALLWAY... filled with LOUD TEENAGERS from the ag 9-18. Her limp. has gotten worse. She WINKS at someone... then turns a corner and the CAMER whips around to reveal WALTER standing at his locker. He closes the door, revealing Dana and another friend named CHARLES ( 12) standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does your mom limp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... is something wrong with her foot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana saw her take her shoe off in the parking lot yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's definitely something wrong with her foot. It looks mangled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say mangled... you said it looked gross. Walter lunges at Charles and pushes him up against the locker... awkwardly trying to fight him.
They continue to wrestle awkwardly for a moment against t lockers and then Walter lets go... backing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever make fun of my mom again I'll kill you! Walter storms off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA moves through the SCHOOL OFFICE as teachers an RECEPTIONISTS move about in preparation for the last day, approaching a FROSTED GLASS DOOR that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma sits across from the desk of WILLIAM POATES (45), t principal of the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The uhhh... the board came to a vote last week, so it's official. They've officially cancelled the faculty tuition discount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what does that mean for me?

dialogues.speaker: P OATE S
dialogues.text: You're going to have to start paying full tuition for your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next semester. Norma notices a SMALL DROP of BLOOD forming in his right nostril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm real sorry about this, Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. I've got three weeks to figure out how to tell my son we can't afford to send him to Collegiate any more. The drop of blood has begun to flow down onto his upper l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, I'm real sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... your nose is bleeding. Poates reaches for his HANDKERCHIEF and puts it to his fa wiping off the blood. The MORNING BELL rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma walks hurriedly down the empty hallway. Her limp ha gotten worse as the morning grind has now begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma comes into her CLASSROOM... a SCIENCE LAB with SINK and BUNSEN BURNERS mounted in MARBLE TOP DESKS. Kids are moving about... loud and rambunctious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... everyone quiet down! Take your seats! Norma moves toward a stack of METAL TRAYS on her desk. In of each tray is a BALL OF BLACK MUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today is the day many of you have been eagerly awaiting. You get to dissect owl pellets. A MALE STUDENT ( 13) pumps his fist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Norma sets an OWL PELLET down in front of a FEMALE STUDEN ( 12). She looks at the owl pellet in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so gross. Norma sets a tray down in front of Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they call it an owl pellet? A MALE STUDENT ( 12) next to him takes his tray from Norm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they shit out of their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... watch the language. You say another cuss word I've gotta send you to detention, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mrs. Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is what true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That owls poo out of their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... this is true. The classroom gasps in disgust... others laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey forest owls feed upon field mice, squirrels and small birds. The owl will then regurgitate the bones and waste matter in a ball of black mucous. Inside this mucous you will likely find the entire skeleton of its prey. Norma goes to the front of the room and lowers a SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to show you a film about the digestive process of the owl, and how the owl pellet is formed. The classroom whispers with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur pulls through the ENTRANCE GATE at the NASA LANGLE RESEARCH CENTER. He retrieves his BADGE from the dashboar and shows it to the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur's car drives down MAIN STREET on the campus of the research center. The buildings are predominately drab, functional, one story brick structures.. surrounded by various GLOBE STRUCTURES and PIPE NETWORKS on manicured g lawns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks with Arthur as he moves through the cro corridor of one of the research buildings. He says hello various colleagues along the way. All of the men at the facility are dressed the same... wi white shirts and TIES and POCKET PROTECTOR BADGES. The pl resembles an all-male community college for young scienti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur eases his way into the small, crowded AUDITORIUM t serves as a MEDIA ROOM. A PRESS CONFERENCE is underway. NORM CAHILL ( 40s), the VIKING PROJECT COORDINATOR, is standing at the podium. Next to him is an OVERHEAD PROJEC with maps and various schematics projected from it onto a LARGE SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been five months since the Viking lander touched down on the surface of Mars. We've seen dozens of photographs of the rock covered surface... what can you now tell us about the tests you've been conducting? Is there any sign of life on the red planet? Arthur takes a seat in the back of the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... there are three separate tests that we've been conducting... Pyrolytic Release, Labeled Release and Gas Exchange. The first two tests, based on soil samples about 22 centimeters deep, came back negative... and the third is... still pending. Cahill smiles. Laughter erupts from various parts of the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you elaborate on test number three? Cahill places a transparent MAP of the mars surface on th overhead projector and begins to draw on it with a WAX PENCIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gas exchange experiment measures the production or uptake of C02, nitrogen, methane, hydrogen, and oxygen during the incubation of the martian soil sample.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you showing us all of the photos? Are there little green men up there? Laughter from the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... there is a possibility that the planet abounds with chemical compounds produced by living systems. Their chemical nature, distribution and structural uniqueness could be used to argue the presence of microscopic living organisms on Mars. As Cahill moves on to the next question... Arthur taps th reporter on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all comes down to water. Arthur points to an OVERHEAD SATELLITE PHOTO of Utopia Planitia, a raised level of martian terrain in the vicini of the site where VIKING II landed. There are dry river-bed formations in the soil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we find water beneath the surface... and the topographic maps of Utopia Planitia indicate that there were once rivers on the surface of the planet, it's possible that we'll eventually find evidence of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OWL PELLET FILM is underway. Norma sits in the back o the class next to the projector. She crosses her legs... reaching for her foot... massaging it gently. She cringes clearly in intense pain. Charles looks back at her... noticing this. They make eye contact... and Charles turns back to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur now sits across from Cahill in his office. Behind is a window that overlooks a huge laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Arthur, but they've denied your application to be admitted into the astronaut program. Arthur looks crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, son... but they don't tell us why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks through a LARGE LABORATORY in the heart one of the main buildings on the Langley campus. Work tables assembled with LABORATORY EQUIPMENT and MACHI extend out into infinity as DOZENS OF YOUNG MEN, all dres in similar white shirts with NASA ID BADGES move througho engaged in various tasks. Arthur is standing at a LABORATORY TABLE with a WHITE MAS on. He is wearing a LAB COAT and GLASSES. He pours PINK LIQUID onto the surface of a METAL PAN... filling it to the edges. A colleague named WENDELL JAMES ( 29) walks over to see w he is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they really with-holding some of the Mars photos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, man. Jesus... what's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a salinic compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you making?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas present for Norma. Arthur retrieves a WHITE CERAMIC MOLD. The mold has an extrusion that is shaped like a WOMAN'S FOOT... only the of the foot is round and missing its toes, save for the P TOE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new prosthesis for her foot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Arthur carefully impresses the MOLD of his wife's foot in the pink goop... sealing the mold at the edges into the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you change up this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compound they're developing for the pilot chairs on the space shuttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: The BONES of a FIELD MOUSE have been re-assembled rough form within the tray... as the OWL PELLET has been ripped apart. The tray belongs to Charles, and he has grown tired of dissecting the owl pellet. He looks up to the head of the class and sees that Norma sitting up on her desk... filing her nails... waiting out last remaining minutes of the period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lewis?
She raises her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your foot? She just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened... to my foot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend... she saw you take your shoe off. She said... that there's something wrong with it. The whole class goes silent. Norma begins to blush. She l down at her right foot, hidden inside of a CLOSED-TOE SHO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it's a long story. She looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got five minutes until second period. She looks back at her class and sees that their curiosity been piqued. She has no choice now but to tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... I'll tell you what happened to my foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits at the table with Wendell... waiting for the to dry. Arthur is dealing a deck of cards as they begin a game of GIN RUMMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she was seventeen... still living in Texas, her brother dropped a barbell on her foot... broke three of her toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA pans across the faces of STUDENTS as they list to her tell the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so I go to see the doctor. He goes to take an X-ray of my foot to see if the bones are broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur discards... then retrieves a replacement card from stack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this dumb-ass Richmond doctor takes the x-ray... then he goes to check on another patient down the hall. Arthur discards a king.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This dumb--ass... he left the x-ray machine on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. That's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma raises up her right shoe to show the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found out that the tissue in four of my toes had been completely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: destroyed by the radiation. Norma swivels around on the desk and places her right foo against her left inner thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they have to amputate four of my toes. And then they had to take a bunch of skin from my inner thigh to cover the front of my foot. This is back in 1963... so they didn't have the skin graft techniques they do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stands up and takes his RIGHT FOOT... pulls it up touches it to his LEFT INNER THIGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had to sit there in a hospital bed in the same position for six months, waiting for it to heal. Wendell stares at the mold on the laboratory table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. I hope she sued this idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Her family sued. They won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the settlement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty thousand dollars. Arthur pulls the ceramic mold out of the pink goop... and see the IMPRESSION of her disfigured foot inside the new PROSTHESIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma turns around and uncrosses her legs. They now dangl over the edge of the lab desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want to see it? Now that the secret is out... I don't want you spreading rumors about my mangled foot. The class responds enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... gather round... take a look at the freak show. As the kids gather around... Norma removes her right shoe reveals her disfigured foot... missing every toe but her pinky. A rounded piece of SCAR TISSUE covers the rest of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur takes the trimmed PROSTHESIS and wraps it in tissu paper, then places it in a CARDBOARD BOX with a red bow o it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this sucker works... she can, start jogging again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana walks up to Walter as he stands in front of his lock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I said that her foot looked gross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't look gross... it looks cool. And if you can't tell the difference between gross and cool... then I feel sorry for you, Dana. Walter walks off... leaving her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma emerges from her car carrying GROCERY BAGS in both arms. Walter comes out of the garage with his bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I need a baby-sitter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're nine years old. You're not a geezer yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 1976, mom. Times are changing. Nine years old isn't what it used to be. I think I'm ready to get a moped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not buying you a moped, Walter. Stick with the bike... and be home before dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Walter rides off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma comes into the foyer, groceries in hand. The PHONE ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma comes into the kitchen, sets the groceries down on kitchen table. She grabs the phone off the wall and puts to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? There is silence on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? A MOMENT OF SILENCE... then the caller disconnects. Norma hangs up the phone and starts unloading the groceri The box sits on the table... but she takes no notice of i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur emerges from a NASA CAMPUS GYMNASIUM into the twil with Wendell. Both are covered in sweat, dressed in gym clothes. Arthur is carrying his BASKETBALL and a gym bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the commute back to Richmond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too bad. Maybe an hour and twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Norma I said hello. Wendell watches him walk across the lawn to the parking lot... approaching his car. He lights a cigarette and tak drag... then looks at his watch. INSERT: His watch shows that it is 4:58 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma sits on the couch... smoking a CIGARETTE. On the TELEVISION... the LOCAL NEWS is playing. The DOORBELL rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma opens the front door. A man named ARLINGTON STEWARD (40) is standing there, his body is turned in profile. He is wearing a crisp wool sui and a BLACK HAT, with a BRIEFCASE in his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lewis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Arlington Steward. Her eyes light up, as she remembers the name and the box. Arlington then rotates his body... revealing the RIGHT SI of his face. Norma's eyes widen in horror at what she see Nearly all of the right side of his face from his cheekbo to his lower jaw has been burned away. His rear MOLARS an GUMS are exposed beneath the absence of tissue that is supposed to conceal them. Norma immediately feels a strange connection... a deep sympathy for him and the pain he must have endured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume you received the box that I left on your doorstep. His speech has a slight impediment from the burn that ext to the right side of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Yes we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you retrieved the button unit inside of the box. Norma smiles. He smiles back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The button unit. That's what you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed. May I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Norma turns and leads him back into the kitchen. She retrieves the button unit from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what it this thing? I assume you're trying to sell me something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... in a way, yes. I do have an offer to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What are you selling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A financial opportunity. Arlington gestures toward the table with his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I? She nods. He places the briefcase down on the table. He takes the button unit from her and sets it down on the kitchen table. They both sit down. He then withdraws a SMALL YELLOW ENVELOPE from his suit jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: inside of this envelope is a key. Arlington opens the envelope and withdraws a small METAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the key that opens the glass dome of the button unit. Arlington then inserts the key into a small HORIZONTAL SL at the top edge. He turns the key, and the LID that house the GLASS DOME pops lose. The METAL BUTTON is now exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you push the button, one of two things will happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, someone... somewhere in the world... who you do not know... will die. Norma just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, you will receive a payment of two-hundred thousand dollars... tax free. Arlington opens the briefcase. Inside are neatly stacked of ONE-HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money will be delivered to you in cash. Norma covers her mouth... shocked at the sight of so much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you for real? Arlington smiles back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lewis, I can assure you that the offer is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you work for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guarantee of payment has several restrictions. One... I am not permitted to disclose any information about to the identity of my employers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two... if you discuss the details of this financial opportunity with anyone other than your husband, the offer is null and void, and you will not receive the money in return for having pushed the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... you have twenty four hours. Arlington glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have until five o'clock tomorrow evening to make your decision whether or not to push the button. At that time, I will return to retrieve the button unit from you. It will be re-programmed and the offer will be made to someone else. Arlington places the key back into the envelope, seals it with crisp precision, and hands it over to her. He then closes the briefcase and stands up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until then... a good day to you, Mrs. Lewis. He nods his head and turns toward the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows him toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... you're just going to leave me with this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of joke? Who are you? He opens the front door and turns back to her with a frie smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Arlington Steward, and I can assure you that this is no joke. The offer is real, but I am not at liberty to disclose any more information than I already have. He withdraws a BUSINESS CARD and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day. He heads down the walk toward his car. She looks down at the card and sees that his name is prin in an embossed BLACK FONT:
She turns the card over and sees what looks like a PHONE NUMBER printed on the back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands there in the doorway and watches him step into automobile, start the engine and drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter is sitting on a bench in front of a line of shops CARYTOWN. Dana approaches him. He turns to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I just wanted to tell you... that I think your mom is beautiful. Walter just stares at her in silence... wanting to forgiv her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma walks back into the kitchen, holding the key envelo in one hand and the business card in the other. She stares at them both, then down at the box. She then retrieves the key from the envelope and inserts it into t slot, opening the glass dome. She stares at the button for a long moment... then closes dome. She closes her eyes... trying to make sense of what just transpired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA zooms out from a RINGING PHONE that sits on a KITCHEN COUNTER in a large suburban house. SUSAN BURNS (5 goes to answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey honey. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... I just... The CAMERA continues to zoom out, revealing her husband, BURNS (50s) laid out in a recliner, watching television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma stares at the business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... something just happened and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I don't want to talk about it right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan carries the phone into the family room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. (covering the phone) Jim... you gotta get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. He sits up and moves toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait until you see the spread tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma twirls the phone cord around her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. I think they're spending more on their wedding than we did on our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your foot acting up again?
Norma leans against the wall... lifting her right foot of the floor to ease the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little, yeah. That damn bone. The skin from my leg, it's not as tough as it should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he's gonna be there tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Stupid. Norma takes this in... remembering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it's been what... thirteen years? Bound to run into each other at some point, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma is now wearing only her BRA AND PANTIES, her hair a make-up flawless. She finishes putting on a pair of DIAMO EARRINGS. As she steps into an elegant COCKTAIL DRESS... we see the deep square shaped SCARS on the inside of her LEFT THIGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma comes into the bedroom... and ARTHUR is there... putting on his CUFF LINKS. He is dressed in a TUXEDO. His jacket is laid out on the bed, and next to it is his CHRISTMAS PRESENT. Norma sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little gift from Dr. Rex Morgan. She opens the present and retrieves the PROSTHESIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god!
Norma removes an old, store-bought INSOLE from her right and inserts the new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a material they developed for the new shuttle chairs. It'll absorb the pressure of your foot and re-distribute it across the entire surface area. She then slides her disfigured foot into the shoe... and begins to walk around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Rex... how'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just figured out a way to make it better. She crosses the room and gives him a hug and a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I'd do without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, June.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur come into the family room, wearing their winter coats. Walter is sitting across the coffee table w Dana. They are playing CARDS. The box is sitting between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Mr. Steward show up? Norma sees the box sitting there and immediately grabs it the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... what's it all about. Did he show up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I'll tell you about it in the car. We're running late. Norma leans down and kisses Walter on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be home late... your bedtime is ten. Dana watches them go... her eyes transfixed on the box in Norma's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks with Arthur's car as it drives south on CARY STREET... approaching an intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma has the box sitting in her lap while Arthur drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And before I could ask him anything else... he got in his car... and he pulled off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the license plate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad is cop, Norma. Always get the license plate number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was little overwhelmed, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in the world... someone you do not know will die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those were his exact words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say how they would die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he showed you the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He said it was two-hundred thousand. It looked real to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know. I think he's a burn victim. Poor thing... half of his face is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe he's a life insurance salesman. Maybe that's what it is. It's some kind of survey. We push the button and he offers us a discount on a two-hundred thousand dollar life insurance policy. Joke's on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA descends upon the COUNTRY CLUB OF VIRGINIA. It a MASSIVE COLONIAL MANSION that sits upon a huge hill tha littered with CHRISTMAS LUMINARIES that glow in the night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We approach Arthur's car as they pull into a PARKING SPAC front of the main entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur grabs the box from off her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring the key with you? She hands it to him. He takes the key and inserts it... opening the glass dome He then takes his INDEX FINGER and places it on the butto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna push the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!
Norma reaches over and snaps the dome closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's for real. She takes the box back from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He was... he seemed very sure of himself. If it's some kind of survey... then... he's a really good salesman because I believe him. I believe that he might give us that money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do then you think he's a maniac and he might go kill someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Arthur takes the box back from her. He shakes it... then flips it over. He sees that there is a SINGLE SCREW on th bottom corner that holds it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the glove compartment. There's a philips head screwdriver in there. She opens the GLOVE COMPARTMENT and retrieves a PHILLIPS SCREWDRIVER for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Arthur is now unscrewing the bottom of the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna see what's inside of it. He removes the screw... and sees that the wooden base rot on a ROD MOUNT on the opposite corner. INSIDE... it is completely empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... no transmitter... no radio. If we pushed the button right now... he'd have no way of knowing. She takes the box from him and closes the dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur pops open the trunk and Norma places the box insid He shuts the trunk and they begin to walk toward the entr to the COUNTRY CLUB. Arthur then holds out his hand to hi wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me hold the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you get to hold it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you'll lose it Norma. You can't hold your liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither can you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if someone takes your purse? I have pockets. Let me hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Norma goes through her purse and hands the small envelope him. They move toward the entrance to the country club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA follows Norma and Arthur into the GRAND BALLRO of the country club. There are several hundred people there... all dressed in black tie. A MASSIVE CHRISTMAS TR sits in the center of the room, surrounded by tables. A PIANO PLAYER plays CHRISTMAS CAROLS up on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. All this for a rehearsal dinner... Deborah is so lucky. Remember our rehearsal dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Keg party in our back yard. Susan and Jim are standing with ARTHUR LEWIS, SR (50s) an BEV LEWIS ( 50s). Arthur and Norma go over to greet them. The CAMERA drifts over to a PLACARD that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana enters the family room and hands a package to Walter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas... Walter takes the package and begins to remove the wrappin paper. Inside is a COMIC BOOK. He pulls it out of the wrapping.. and on the cover is an illustration of a DARK FIGURE walk upon a RED DESERT SURFACE. The title is: THE MAN FROM MARS Walter looks at the cover in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Dana. My dad is gonna love this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur are now seated around a table with both of parents. Bev is running her hand through Arthur's long hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you gonna cut this hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still cutting his hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. ARTHUR SR. Are you Leonard or Skynard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well honey... they're never gonna let you into outer space with these sideburns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all wearing them that way now, Bev.
NATHAN BURNS ( 26), Norma's wheelchair-bound younger brot comes rolling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outer space? Is someone planning on departing the surface of the earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan! Arthur stands up and gives him a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been years. How have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been better... I mean, I used to have legs... The table goes silent... Susan looks as though she might start to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... morbid humor. What's this talk about outer space?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur has been working at Nasa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helped design the camera that photographed the Mars surface. Arthur puts his hands on the back of Nathan's wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and I are gonna go grab a drink... He begins to wheel Nathan toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur made me a new prosthesis for my foot. Some space age formula... it's incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he make Nathan a pair of prosthetic legs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur now sits with Nathan over by the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe it? I survive eighteen months crawlling through the Vietnam jungle and not one bullet so much as grazes my body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I come home, take a few tabs of LSD at a Grateful Dead show and wrap my car around a tree. Arthur doesn't know how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty damn sad... losing the legs that way, but I always thought it was Karmic retribution for what I did to Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you ever do to Norma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dropped that barbell on her foot when we were kids. That's why she went to get that x-ray. If it wasn't for me... she'd still have all her toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't think of it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? It's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't leave the x-ray machine on, Dr. Stupid did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but my mistake sent her to Dr. Stupid... so that makes me culpable in the eyes of Buddha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no more culpable than the company that manufactured the barbell. Stop punishing yourself. Nathan smiles in appreciation and takes a long swig of Ja Daniels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Stupid. Nathan nods his head across the room... where DR. EARL ST ( 50s) is seated at a table with his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Earl Stupe. He's still got a practice over on the west end. Arthur looks over at him... for a moment they make brief contact... and Stupe quickly looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is now staring at Dr. Stupe. They are joined by DEB BURNS (24), Norma's younger sister and bride-to-be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if he even recognizes us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe they still let him practice medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta let it go. You gotta learn to forgive and forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be willing to forgive him if he would've just admitted his negligence under oath. The bastard lied... said it was the x-ray machine that malfunctioned. SENATOR GRIFFITH POWELL (50s) and his son EDWARD POWELL ( 20s), approach. Edward is the husband-to-be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Senator! You look very spiffy tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that the mid-term elections are over... the smile lines are starting to fade. Powell puts on a fake smile, grabs Jim's hand and they bo wave... poking fun at politician behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... we all voted! Powell looks over at Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. He shakes her hand... fascinated by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're married to the aspiring astronaut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. There he is right over there. She points over to Arthur the bar. Powell looks over at him... and they briefly make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana and Walter are sitting on the floor, playing MONOPOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take me down to the basement? I want to see your dad's darkroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana and Walter come down the stairs into the BASEMENT of house. RED LIGHT envelops the room. There are two long wo WORK BENCHES running down the middle. There are a series of BLACK AND WHITE PHOTOGRAPHS hanging from a wire. Each one shows a different view of the surfa of MARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Mars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did your dad have to do with the Viking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helped design the camera. Walter points to a PLASTIC PROTOTYPE MODEL of the VIKING LANDER mounted on a third WORK BENCH at the end of the ro A model of the MARS SURFACE has been re-created and paint with exacting detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's making the model for the science museum. Walter points to one of TWO CAMERAS mounted on the front the SPIDER-SHAPED LANDING MODULE. The camera is cylindric and features a VERTICAL SLOT on the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They designed the camera to photograph in 360 degrees. It scans in the image one line at a time... and takes about five minutes to complete one revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do they get the images back to earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio transmission. They figured out a way to interpret the scan lines and then print them onto film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does it take to transmit back to earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About ten hours. Dana looks over at the wall and sees a NEW YORK TIMES FRO PAGE from September with a large image of MARS on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tested the camera in the parking lot at Langley last year. Walter points to another FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH on the wall. I the black & white photograph, we see a group of FIFTY EMPLOYEES assembled in a long line in a PARKING LOT. Walter points to his father standing in the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's my dad. He moves his finger across the line of smiling faces... ARTHUR appears for a SECOND TIME in the row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there he is again. Walter then moves his finger down toward the right side o the photo... ARTHUR LEWIS appears for a third time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there he is again. Dana looks close at the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the camera takes five minutes to scan in 360 degrees, he waited until the camera passed over him then jumped ahead in the circle. The CAMERA moves in closer to the photograph... to the TH VERSION of ARTHUR LEWIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad sounds pretty clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad is more than just clever, Dana. My dad is the coolest man who ever walked the face of the earth. The CAMERA ZOOMS in close to Arthur's face... then tips d to another MAN kneeling on the pavement directly below hi It is ARLINGTON STEWARD... smiling at the camera. His fac normal... no evidence of any burn visible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur are now DANCING among a group of people front of the stage the stage, where a WOMAN SINGER is performing WHITE CHRISTMAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-hundred thousand dollars is a lot of money, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would we do with that kind of money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could get out of Richmond... move to California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we could cross the border into Mexico if they ever came after us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't arrest someone for pushing a button, Arthur. It's not a weapon. It's not a gun. We wouldn't be culpable... not in a court of law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's someone's baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's some murderer on death row in China?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's our neighbor across the street. Do you know our neighbors across the street? Have you ever met them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Doug and Donna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm. I haven't met Doug or Donna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it mean to officially know someone, anyway? Do you know me, Norma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you better than you know yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even better than I know you. They spin around on the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a stupid prank, Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life insurance. Arthur gazes across the ballroom toward the bar. Nathan s there alone... finishing his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma watch as Jim hoists Nathan up into their with a HYDRAULIC LIFT. He is passed out drunk. Behind him... Dr. Stupe is waiting in line at the valet f his car. He and Norma make eye contact. His eyes dart dow the pavement as he steps into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur come into the family room. Dana is aslee the couch. Norma sets the box down on the coffee table an goes to wake Dana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana... Dana's eyes slowly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur will drive you home, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my bike... and my house isn't far from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's asleep upstairs. Arthur hands Dana a ten dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Dana. Dana exits through the front door. Norma stands up and mo toward the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you turn off the Christmas tree lights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like leaving them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fire hazard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It keeps the Christmas spirit alive while we sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone dies eventually, Norma. She stares at the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Leave them on. She goes upstairs... leaving him alone with the glowing t Arthur looks down at the coffee table. The box sits there taunting him. He retrieves the KEY ENVELOPE from his pock and stares at it. He then walks over to the wall and unplugs the Christmas lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur lay in bed, facing in opposite direction Neither of them can sleep. Arthur rolls over and wraps his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA approaches Walter's bed. He has made a TENT un the covers. A light glows from inside. UNDER THE COVERS... Walter has a flashlight and he is rea the comic book. INSERT: Various illustrations from the comic... a HUGE TE with a massive flying beast flying above it. A METEOR hurtling toward EARTH...

::WT. CARYTOWN E.kT-R S -LO1 -- EARLY MORNING At the CARYTOWN HAIR SALON... the CAMERA zooms out from N as she sits under a DOME, drying her hair. Next to her is sister Deborah and several other BRIDESMAIDS for the wedd The other women are gabbing... reading fashion magazines. Norma seems lost in her own world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Deborah emerge from the hair salon with the oth in tow. Lurking down at the end of the sidewalk is Bud Wa Walter's bus-driver. The huge man watches them intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma has Arlington's BUSINESS CARD out. She stares at th number. Arthur comes in with the morning paper. The box sits on the kitchen table. She retrieves the key inserts it into the slot... opening the glass dome. Arthu comes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never see that much money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be realistic Arthur... you work for the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never leave Richmond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to put Walter in public school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collegiate withdrew the faculty tuition discount.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we sold my car and moved into a smaller house, we couldn't afford that school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd have to enroll him at Hopewell. Unless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless what, Norma? She reaches out and holds her finger over the button... thinking. She then picks up the business card with her ot hand, flips it over and stares at the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Norma begins to dial the number on the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA cranes down into the WILLOW LAWN MOTEL on the north side of Richmond. The two-story building has a SWIM POOL adjacent to south side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA zooms out from a RINGING TELEPHONE that sits o the bedside table. Arlington sits on the bed... staring silently at the wall picks up the receiver and places it to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Mrs. Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma pauses for a moment... wondering how he could have known it was her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Mr. Steward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know it was me... are you tracing this call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is running out... have you made your decision? Norma looks to Arthur... who paces around the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we push the button... are you going to murder someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington leans back on the motel room bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you push the button... somewhere in this world... someone you do not know... will die. I never mentioned the word murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will they die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not at liberty to disclose that information. Besides... it would spoil the fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you selling life insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not at liberty to disclose any information about my employers. I can only remind you that the offer is real... (looking at his watch) .and it expires in approximately eight hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do this? What do you get out of this deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely nothing. The reward is for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma paces around with the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything else, Mrs. Lewis? I have an appointment to make and I don't want to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we meet in person? I'd like to see you... before we make our final decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why... I'm looking at you right now, Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grey spotted owl... in your back yard. Norma turns and looks out the large picture window in the kitchen nook. Outside in the back yard, an OWL is perched a planter. The large bird sits motionless... its large SAUCER EYES d not blink. Norma stares at it for a long moment... transfixed. Arthu paces around the kitchen... facing in the other direction Outside... the owl flies away before Arthur notices it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? There is no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Steward? Are you still there? Norma hangs up the phone. She stares at the box... then a her husband, as he sits down across from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do Norma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna have to pull Walter out of that school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then push it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push the button, Norma... push the button. I dare you. I double-dog diddly dare you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... if you don't push it... then I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is stupid. Arthur reaches out to push the button... but she grabs hi wrist with her left hand, restraining him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies first. She then reaches out and presses down on the button with index finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks along a series of CUBICLES at the POLIC STATION in downtown Richmond. A FEMALE OPERATOR sits at e cubicle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 911 emergency... how may I direct your call? The CAMERA moves in closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? You need to slow down... I can't understand what you're saying. She listens to the voice on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you heard loud screaming and then a gun shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1500 Cary Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two POLICE CARS pull up with their SIRENS blaring in fron a TOWNHOUSE on Cary Street. TWO POLICE OFFICERS emerge fr each car and approach the front of the townhouse. They begin to bang loudly on the door. A FEMALE NEIGHBOR (20s) emerges from the townhouse next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard a gunshot... then he ran out the front door and got in his car. The POLICE OFFICER looks at his partner and then proceeds KICK DOWN the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OFFICERS move through the townhouse with their GUNS drawn. The SCREAMING of a YOUNG GIRL can be heard from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OFFICERS enter the kitchen. A WOMAN (20s) named AMY BEVILACQUA is slumped over on the kitchen floor in a pool blood. The CAMERA moves in toward her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OFFICER approaches the BATHROOM DOOR at the end of the hall. The screaming girl from inside is bawling her eyes The Officer sees a tiny HAND emerge from underneath the d She is reaching out for help. He goes to open the door, b there is a LARGE DEAD BOLT LOCK mounted on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... I need you to back away from the door... I'M GONNA HAVE TO

dialogues.speaker: KICK IT DOWN
dialogues.text: The screaming begins to subside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: okay... The Officer then kicks the door down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the bathroom... a YOUNG GIRL (7) is cowering in th bathtub... hyperventilating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur are sitting across from one another in silence. There is an empty BOTTLE OF WINE on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no turning back now. Seconds later... THE DOORBELL RINGS. Both Norma and Arthur jump in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur move toward the front door. Norma puts h eye to the PEEPHOLE. Arlington's disfigured face stares b at her. She opens the door. Arlington stands there smiling... briefcase in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs. Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the button unit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh... yeah... it's in the kitchen. Norma goes to the kitchen to retrieve the box, leaving Ar alone with Arlington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you must be Mr. Lewis.
Arthur stares at him... transfixed. Does he recognize him from somewhere? Norma returns with the box and hands it over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... sorry... Norma reaches into her pocket and retrieves the small envelope and places it in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Arlington then opens the BRIEFCASE and shows it to them. Inside... the bills are stacked neatly in rows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-hundred thousand. You can count it if you like. Arthur takes the briefcase from him and then closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... we trust your word. Arlington offers him a broad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you should. He then turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow Arlington out onto the front walk as he approaches his car. The engine is idling... and someone e is behind the wheel... but through the tinted windows it unclear who is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said before that the box is re- programmed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now what? Are you gonna go and make the offer to someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why yes. That-'s how it works, Mrs. Lewis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I can promise you that the offer will be made... to someone you do not know. He smiles... opens the door... and steps into the passeng side. The driver hits the gas and the car speeds off. Arthur moves out into the street... watching the car go..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got his license plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur comes into the kitchen and goes to the desk and gr a PENCIL. He then scrawls the LICENSE PLATE NUMBER down o piece of scratch paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking, Norma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Arthur paces around... thinking. He then opens the briefc and starts counting through the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he mean that we're next? Is that what he meant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Burns sits behind his desk at the POLICE STATION. His SECRETARY (20s) comes in to his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter is on line two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. He picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma stares at the money in the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... what do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to run a license plate for me. Someone just came by the house... and we think he might... (looking to Arthur) He just seemed real suspicious and Arthur got the license plate and I need you to run it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay honey... you need me to send someone over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... if you could just run the plate and find out whose car it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AXV-4049 is the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you back in ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OFFICER removes a document from a PRINTER and approach Burns's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ran those plates for you, sarge. Jim takes the document from him. It is a blow-up of a driver's license that belongs to ARLINGTON STEWARD. In th photo... his face is not injured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur are pacing around the kitchen... thinkin The PHONE rings... Norma answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is listed to an Arlington J. Steward... do you want his address and phone number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Norma begins to write them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma is dialing a number with the phone in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... I'm trying to reach an Arlington Steward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lewis, I presume? Norma's eyes widen. She nods to Arthur and points to the phone. He rushes into the family room to pick up the othe PHONE so he can listen in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: I assume that you pushed the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: There is the myth of Prometheus and Pandora... Prometheus gave Pandora a box... and warned her not to open it. But she did not listen, and when Pandora opened the box...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: she unleashed a torrent of sorrow and misery. Norma stares at Arthur... unable to speak.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Your descent into oblivion has begun. The question remains... what will the cuckold of a husband do... to prevent the death of his beloved Pandora? Arthur stares at Norma... unable to speak.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Because really... Mr. Lewis... do you really know your wife? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: I am the mother of Prometheus... and if you want to save yourself... I suggest that you go to the Richmond Public Library, and find the book with the following call number: F2988.34 Norma is writing the number out on a piece of paper. She disconnects. Arthur steps into the kitchen. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma... NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this isn't real. Tell me this isn't happening. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't real. This isn't happening. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I believe you, Norma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur backs his car out of the driveway and into the str Norma rides shotgun. Walter is circling around on his bik with some friends in tow.
NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're off to run an errand. Be back in a few hours, okay? WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He watches as they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma drive toward downtown. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was owl... in our back yard. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An owl? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said it was his owl. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hiding anything else from me, Norma? NORMA (DEFENSIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks with Arthur and Norma as they move thro the vast space of the RICHMOND PUBLIC LIBRARY. They arriv the ADULT FICTION section... and the CAMERA moves along t spines of various books until it arrives at the one with call number: F2988.34 Norma removes a BOOK from the shelf and looks at the cove NO EXIT JEAN-PAUL SARTRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma shows it to Arthur. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No exit. ARTHUR (MIS-PRONOUNCES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sartre.
NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it's pronounced Sartre. Jean-Paul Sartre. The French existentialist. She begins to thumb through the pages of the play. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never read it. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a play... I read it in high school. It's about three strangers who find themselves trapped in a room together for all of eternity. They've quickly discover that they've all been sent to hell. Norma turns back to the inside cover of the book. Someone has written in crisp penmanship: RICHMOND TIMES-DISPATCH

dialogues.speaker: SEPTEMBER 3, 1976
dialogues.text: Norma runs her hand down the list of names on the library card. The name of the last person to check out the book i STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma approach the circulation desk. A female LIBRARIAN ( 70s) is standing there. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... we're looking for an archival Times-Dispatch from September of this year. She offers them a warm smile. LIBRARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Microfiche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma now sit in front of a MICROFICHE READER long line of wooden desks in the RECORDS ROOM. On the screen... HEADLINES from the year's newspapers scr by... stopping on the headline for SEPTEMBER 3, 1976:

dialogues.speaker: VIKING LANDER SENDS FIRST IMAGES OF RED PLANET BACK TO EA
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington Steward... I remember the name now. He used to work at NASA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Wendell are standing among a large group of SCIENTISTS in the laboratory. Everyone is assembled... staring at a large BLANK SCREEN, waiting in anticipation. Cahill stands at the front of th group with a WALKIE-TALKIE to his ear. CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... the first photo should come down off the server in less than a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA cranes up toward the GIGANTIC LUNAR LANDER MOD Rain pours down from the night sky. Lightning flashes in distance... several miles away. Thunder rumbles. The CAMERA approaches the UPPER TRESTLE BEAM... which cro the expanse of the structure. Mounted on top of the beam MASSIVE ANTENNAE. Standing on the trestle several yards away from the anten is ARLINGTON STEWARD. He is wearing a rain slicker and is face appears normal. He carries a walkie-talkie in his ri hand. ARLINGTON (INTO WALKIE-TALKIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So place your bet... martians or no martians?
