dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stares up at the screen... waiting on baited breat Moments later... a LARGE BLACK AND WHITE PHOTO OF THE MAR SURFACE appears on the screen. The SCIENTISTS erupt in loud cheering and applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the base of the LUNAR LANDER MODULE... a NASA EMPLOY named ROBERT BEVILACQUA (31) is standing with two others. They are huddled under UMBRELLAS..'. smoking cigarettes. Bevilacqua has a WALKIE-TALKIE to his ear. He hears the cheering from the walkie-talkie. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touchdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur scrolls down to the bottom of the front page. A SMALLER ARTICLE:

dialogues.speaker: NASA EMPLOYEE STRUCK BY LIGHTNING
dialogues.text: ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An engineer at the NASA Langley research center was struck by lightning yesterday evening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington looks at his watch... staring up at the sky... nervous about the storm. RAIN pours down upon on the module... water running down in sheets on either side of trestle. He hears the cheering from the walkie-talkie. Thunder rum in the distance. Moments later... a MASSIVE LIGHTNING BOLT STRIKES THE TOP TRESTLE BEAM.

dialogues.speaker: THROWN ONTO HIS BACK... HIS BODY ENGULFED IN FLAMES.
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua witnesses the FIRE on the lunar lander module. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Bevilacqua and the others begin to sprint across the lawn toward the base of the structure to the ELEVATOR DOOR at bottom of the elevator shaft on the south end of the modu
INT. RICHMOND PUBLIC LIBP.F.RY -- RECORDS ROOM -- NE t"T Arthur continues to read from the article. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man received third degree burns over fifty percent of his body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua and the others emerge from the ELEVATOR at the of the trestle. They rush toward Arlington's body... as h convulses on the trestle... smoke emanating from his char body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur turns to Norma. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got struck by lightning on the night we received the transmission from Mars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Wendell stand outside the main laboratory buil with a group of scientists, sipping champagne. They see a AMBULANCE pass down the main street of the campus with it sirens on. Cahill emerges from inside the building and rushes out to parking lot. Bevilacqua and the others are approaching. CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The module got hit! CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning? BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Steward was up there on the trestle. He got burned real bad! The CAMERA moves in toward Bevilacqua's face... his eyes filled with anguish and despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Burns stands in front of a group of POLICE OFFICERS i briefing room. He holds up a large FAMILY PHOTO of ROBERT BEVILACQUA, posing with his WIFE and YOUNG DAUGHTER. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our fugitive is named Robert Bevilacqua. He shot and killed his wife at their residence on Cary Street earlier today. We believe that he escaped on foot... and could be armed and dangerous. The CAMERA moves across a line of POLICE OFFICERS... listening... JIM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bevilacqua is an employee at NASA... and he is a former Marine who served in Vietnam. He may very well be armed and dangerous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks through a dingy RICHMOND DIVE BAR. Bevilacqua sits at the bar with a baseball cap pulled dow low to conceal his face. He is drinking whiskey. Wendell James approaches... carrying a FILE under his arm WENDELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua... Bevilacqua turns to face him. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendell. They hug one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men are now sitting across from one another in a BOOTH. Wendell has a NASA BLUE-PRINT laid out on the tabl The blue-print is of the button unit. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You designed it? WENDELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Cahill told me to...
Bevilacaua notices a SMALL PURPLE STAIN on the blue-print

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cahill stands over Wendell's shoulder as he sits at a DRAFTING TABLE in the laboratory. WENDELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This what you were looking for, sir? Cahill looks stares at the blue-print... possessed. A DRO BLOOD falls from his right nostril and lands on it. CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you Wendell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA moves through the MASSIVE MAIN HANGAR at Langl There are several planes parked inside. Wendell emerges f behind one of the planes... watching from a hidden vantag point... Cahill stands at a work table with Arlington. There are T BUTTON UNITS laid out on the table. Arlington begins to p them inside a leather bag. Cahill then hands Arlington a FILE. CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna hurt these boys, are you? ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any harm that comes to them will be their own doing. Arlington takes the bag and moves toward the hangar entra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside... there is a MASSIVE CEMENT RUNWAY. Parked on th runway is Arlington's car. BUD WALL steps out and opens t door for his boss. Bus-Driver Bud is Steward's driver... Arlington steps inside. Wendell watches them drive off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendell then hands a file to Bevilacqua. Inside there is dossier and photo of a ARTHUR LEWIS. He flips to another dossier and photo of another NASA EMPLOYEE named KENNETH WELLER. WENDELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a list... and they've all got a wife and one child. Bevilacqua thumbs through the list of NASA dossiers. He s Arthur Lewis among them. WENDELL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill your wife? Bevilacqua just stares at him... on the verge of tears. H slides an ENVELOPE across the table. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a confession letter that I wrote... it explains everything that happened with Steward and the box. Keep it... cause if I don't make it... this might clear my name one day. Bevilacqua looks at the KENNETH WELLER dossier. BEVILACQUA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy Weller is gonna be next. Did you get their phone number? WENDELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They're not listed. Just an old address south of Petersburg. What are you gonna do? BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I need a car. I might be able to save them... and this guy Arthur Lewis... Wendell thinks to himself... then retrieves a set of KEYS from his pocket. WENDELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the keys to my cousin's pick-up truck. It's not registered. It's parked in front of my house over on Byrd street. Take it... BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Wendell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns sits behind his desk... telephone to his ear. JIM (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steward. First name Arlington... middle name is James. He begins to scrawl words down on a piece of paper: NASA

dialogues.speaker: STRUCK BY LIGHTNING
dialogues.text: Just then... his RECEPTIONIST opens the door to his offic RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... there's a Mr. Steward here to see you. JIM (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... that's all I need. He hangs up the phone and looks through the glass window his office into the reception area. Standing there through the glass... is a man who looks identical to Arlington Steward. He stands with the normal side of his face in profile. He turns to face Jim... but his face now appears as it did before he was burned. Is this the same person? Jim turns to his receptionist... who waits in the doorway JIM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The library is closing down for the night. A group of young CHILDREN come out of the front exit. One them turns and notices the OWL perched on the railing. The owl stares at the children...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Arlington Steward is now standing in the periodi area. of the library... situated in front of the circulat desk. He stands in profile... then turns toward the CAMERA in t same manner as his TWIN in the police station. His burned face forms a deformed smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STEWARD TWIN steps into Jim's office. He reaches out shakes Jim's hand. STEWARD TWIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Burns... my name is Reston Steward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington... with his eyes closed... mimics his TWIN'S movement exactly... reaching out his hand and shaking it nothing. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Burns... my name is Reston Steward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTON STEWARD (40) sits down in the chair across from hi desk. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you have made an inquiry about my brother Arlington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington is now seated in a library chair... eyes closed in the exact same manner as his brother. it is as though is controlling his twin brother's body via remote telepat ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . an inquiry about my brother Arlington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stares at him from across his desk. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Apparently he made an appearance at my daughter's house. Your brother works for NASA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington nods his head. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. My brother works at the Langley research facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim nods his head in return. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With my son-in-law. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And may I ask... what do you do, Mr. Steward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his eyes closed... Arlington reaches into his pocket retrieves something imaginary from his pocket. He raises something that we cannot see up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reston is now holding out a GOVERNMENT BADGE with his rig hand. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work for the CIA. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. He then hands Jim one of his cards. Jim looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE
dialogues.text: RESTON STEWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reston rises to his feet... putting his hat on his head. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assure you my brother is of no threat to your daughter. However, the man you're looking for... Robert Bevilacqua. He is very dangerous... and he might try and contact your son-in-law or your daughter. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. RESTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us find Bevilacqua. If and when you do... please call us. Jim stares at the business card as Reston bids him good-b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington is now standing. With his eyes still closed, he nods his head and smiles, then turns and begins to walk several steps. He then stops... takes a deep breath... an opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reston opens his eyes... as if a spirit has suddenly left body. He takes a deep breath and smiles at the Receptioni trying to conceal his expression of horror. He moves toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reston emerges from the General Assembly building. There black town car waiting. A CIA AGENT stands next to it. Reston withdraws a HANDKERCHIEF and wipes BLOOD from his nose.
RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Nathan Teague at the Pentagon. Get him on the phone immediately. The Agent opens the car door, and Reston steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur are still sitting in front of the microf machine. Norma looks like she is going to faint... her fa has gone white. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright, Norma? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I'm gonna faint... She stands up to leave. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom. Norma moves.taward the main library... leaving Arthur alo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma emerges from the records room and walks toward the circulation desk. As she rounds the corner... Arlington emerges from behind a row of book shelves. Norma stops in her tracks... frozen. He stares her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stares at the microfiche reader... transfixed by t newspaper articles. A shadow passes across the wall... and Arthur senses some lurking over his shoulder. He turns to see that it is the LIBRARIAN. Something about her is different... she seems possessed. LIBRARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The myth of Prometheus tells the story of a God who created man. (BEAT) (MORE)
LIBRARIAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Prometheus flew too close to the sun... his wings caught fire... and he fell to the earth. Arthur remembers her voice from the phone call. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that you on the phone? You're his mother... LIBRARIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds your wife fascinating... Mr. Lewis. Her name is ELIZABETH STEWARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma remains frozen... her mind racing. Arlington smiles her... gesturing toward an empty chair. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat... Mrs. Lewis. She looks around... realizing that the library is now completely empty. ARLINGTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. I may look like a monster... but-I can assure you that I am... only human. His face contorts into a broad smile. ARLINGTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth sits down on the chair across from Arthur. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Clymene, mother of five. Prometheus, Atlas, Menoetius, Logan, and Epimetheus. A drop of blood begins to ooze from her left eye as she speaks. ELIZABETH (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epimetheus is the twin brother of Prometheus, but he has become his brother's slave... the victim of his cunning and deceit.

dialogues.speaker: IT. RICHMOND PUBLIC LIBP F,
dialogues.text: Norma is now seated in a chair across from him. He stares deep into her eyes... transfixed by her beauty. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Norma... when was the exact moment that you realized you loved your husband? There is something about him that now makes her feel safe willing to tell him anything. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About five seconds after I laid eyes on him. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when was this? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In college. My sophomore year. He was a year younger than me. We dated for two weeks and then... She stops herself. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You became frightened about something. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I thought... this is too good to be true. When he sees my mangled foot... he's gonna be out the door in ten seconds and he's gonna go tell all his friends. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he respond when you showed him? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were at the drive-in... and he caught a glimpse of the scars on my thigh. He asked me what happened... and I felt this sense of dread. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?
NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you can just see the glow disappear in someone's eyes when they discover something about you that they just can't stomach. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the glow disappear from his eyes? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not Arthur. He was different than the others. He... said that... my scars were cool. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said that they made me more attractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits across from Elizabeth. His mind is racing... trying to put the puzzle pieces together. He looks at his watch. It is almost 5PM. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have worked at this library for forty years. Since 1936, I have read a book a day. 23455 books I have read. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone should nominate you for librarian of the year. She holds the copy of No Exit in her hands. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of all of the books I have read in my lifetime... this is my son's favorite. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever read No Exit? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She reaches out with her hand. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand... and I'll show you.
He stares at the blood coagulating in the bag beneath her left eye. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna touch you, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington now stares directly into Norma's soul. The scar tissue on the left side of his face does not mov when he smiles. It remains frozen... unable to express emotion. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what emotion did you feel when you first laid eyes upon me, Norma? She thinks silently for a moment. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt.. . She stops herself... afraid of how he might respond if sh honest with him. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You felt what? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt... ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pity? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You felt love for me? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of my foot. Because of my disfigurement. I thought of all the pain I've felt in my life because of it... the physical pain... the emotional pain. (BEAT) (MORE)
NORMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about what it would be like to have that pain magnified and projected onto my face... onto a part of my body that I can't hide with a shoe. There are tears welling in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: I saw all of that pain in your face and I understood it... and I felt an overwhelming feeling of love for you because I knew I'd never feel sorry for myself or my goddamn foot ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth continues to hold her hand out toward Arthur. ELIZABETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand, son. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called me a cuckold. You made a statement... made an implication to me that my wife was going to be killed. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So please understand why I might be reluctant to take your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington reaches his hand out to Norma. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand, Norma... She stares at him, unable to move... then takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth reaches out and grabs Arthur's hand against his will. His body convulses at her touch... The CAMERA drifts in toward Arthur's face as his eyes slo close. Her spell has been cast upon him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA moves slowly down a CORRIDOR. The floor is shi white marble and the walls are framed by ornate molding a RENAISSANCE ART. Arlington stands at the end of the corridor. He is wearin TUXEDO, portraying the VALET character from Sartre's No E The CAMERA pans around to reveal Arthur... walking slowly down the corridor. Arlington opens a DOOR at the end of the corridor and lea Arthur into a DRAWING ROOM... recreated from Sartre's pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington leads Arthur inside and closes the door behind Inside the DRAWING ROOM, there are THREE COUCHES made in style.: of the SECOND EMPIRE. The walls are covered in si Renaissance art and the floor is marble. NORMA and WALTER have now been admitted to the drawing ro Norma is dressed in an elegant BLACK GOWN. Walter wears a tuxedo that looks to be nearly identical to the one his father is wearing... and THERE IS A SILK BLINDFOLD WRAPPE AROUND HIS HEAD. He wanders around the room... lost... The dimensions of the room are equal in every way. It is perfect three-dimensional box. Arthur then looks to his wife. He notices that her EYELID are now gone. Arthur then turns to his son. Walter reaches out into the air... seemingly unaware that they are in, the room with him. The CAMERA moves through the wall into another corridor.. BUD WALL... dressed as another VALET, passes by... and th CAMERA moves into another DRAWING ROOM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the SECOND DRAWING ROOM... the CAMERA finds ROBERT BEVILACQUA and his WIFE. Their DAUGHTER is wearing a SILK BLINDFOLD. The CAMERA then drifts up and moves through the GLASS PAN at the top of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA pulls up higher... revealing the layout of a massive network of CORRIDORS and DRAWING ROOMS that form larger box. Through the glass ceilings looking down into room... FAMILIES are assembled together... trapped together... forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA flies over the edge of the SARTRE'S HOTEL of r and corridors to reveal the plateau of UTOPIA PLANITIA on surface of mars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur's eyes pop open... he rolls over... and Norma is asleep in bed next to him. They are both fully dressed in clothes they were wearing in the library. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma... Her eyes open. She looks around... disoriented. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma... what happened? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Norma notices Walter standing in the doorway. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came home an hour ago. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did? She sits up in bed... looking at the clock radio. It is 6 WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of you said a word... you just walked into the house like two zombies. Went straight to bed. Arthur and Norma stare at one another, trying to make sen of what has just transpired. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wedding. It starts in an hour. We've got to get ready.
Norma sees that the copy of No Exit is now sitting on --h bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A U.S. ARMY JET flies over the nation's capital. The PENT and the WASHINGTON MONUMENT are visible below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA approaches US ARMY GENERAL NATHAN TEAGUE ( 50s seated just behind the cockpit. In his lap is a file. He is thumbing through a series of photographs of the MARS SURFACE. He then arrives at a sta of paperwork. There is a photograph of ARTHUR LEWIS at th top of the stack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma, now wearing her BRIDESMAID DRESS, puts a DIAMOND EARRING in her right lobe. She turns to the mirror and ju in her skin... as the face staring back at her has no eyelids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits on the end of Walter's bed. Walters stands in front of him as his father ties his NECK TIE in front of standing mirror. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is about the box... isn't it? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you push the button? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother did. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens when you push the button?
ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do. You're just not telling me. Arthur finishes with his tie. He notices something on the floor of his son's bedroom. It is the MARS COMIC BOOK. He picks it up and stares at the dark figure looming on t cover. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this? WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dana. She gave it to me. Arthur begins to page through the comic book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington kneels at the edge of the MOTEL SWIMMING POOL. runs his hand through the water. Steam is rising from the surface. STROBES OF WHITE LIGHT begin flicker from beneath the surface... as though some unseen SOURCE OF ENERGY is emanating from down below. Arlington slowly rises to his feet and turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington approaches the BLACK SEDAN idling in the car po He gets inside... and Bud drives off.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA looks through a TELESCOPE LENS of some sort fr high on a ROOFTOP in downtown Richmond. It scans across several CARS passing down the street... PEDESTRIANS on the sidewalk... landing on ARLINGTON and B as they move toward the entrance of a STONE FRONT BUILDIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that a SNIPER, dressed in a dark suit, is perched the roof of an adjacent building. He has an earpiece in h left ear.
SNIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... they are entering the building from the south entrance on fourteenth street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington and Bud move down the main corridor of the GENE ASSEMBLY BUILDING, approaching a bank of ELEVATORS. A SECURITY GUARD nods to them nervously. Arlington nods back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington and Bud emerge from the elevators on the THIRD FLOOR and move down the hall. As they pass into a RECEPTI AREA, the CAMERA moves toward a GLASS PARTITION with the VIRGINIA STATE EMBLEM etched into the glass. Below it is a name:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the RECEPTION AREA... the FEMALE RECEPTIONIST ( 30s) stands up anxiously behind her desk. RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... may I help you? ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh... he's in a meeting. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see him... now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RECEPTIONIST comes into the office. Griffith Powell stands at the window behind his desk... smoking a cigaret He is dressed in a TUXEDO with his jacket hanging next to desk.
RECEPTIONIST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here... I don't know what to do. Powell turns to face her. POWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him in. The Receptionist goes back out... and within moments... Arlington and Bud enter the office. The Receptionist clos the door and leaves them alone. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Senator. POWELL (TERRIFIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Steward... it's good to see you. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me Arlington. POWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Arlington. Bud just stares at the Senator... showing no sign of emot ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have my money? POWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given you four-hundred thousand already. How much more are you going to need? ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as it takes. Powell sighs out loud... irritated. ARLINGTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First the nose... Powell turns around and there is now BLOOD GUSHING from h nose... ARLINGTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the ears... BLOOD begins to ooze from both ears... as he covers his face... feeling the warm fluid rush from every orifice... ARLINGTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the eyes...
Blood rushes from beneath his eyelids... his entire face covered in BLOOD... his WHITE SHIRT DRENCHED... POWELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! I've got it right here! Powell reaches beneath his desk and retrieves a large briefcase. He places it on the desk. POWELL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all there! Two-hundred thousand! You can count it if you want! ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud... Bud grabs the briefcase from the desk and pops it open. H sees that it is filled with stacks of cash. ARLINGTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell that sniper you have perched on that roof next door that I can smell his cheap cologne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SNIPER hears Arlington's VOICE in his earpiece. ARLINGTON (EARPIECE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it might be Old Spice. The Sniper smells his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlington and Bud move through the reception area. The Receptionist lurks behind her desk... frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma are standing in a WAITING ROOM in the ch where her sister is about to be married. BRIDESMAIDS and GROOMSMEN are chatting with one another in anticipation o the ceremony. Norma clutches the copy of No Exit. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Walter were there in the room. You were wearing a black dress, identical to the one you have on now. (MORE)
ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter had a blindfold on. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then your eyes... NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't have lids... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the same dream. Arthur's mind is racing... he glances through the crowd nervously, afraid that they are being watched. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the last thing you remember? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The library. He was asking me all of these questions... about you... about our marriage. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I took his hand... Susan approaches... SUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright girls... time to line up! Susan hands Arthur the book and goes off with the other BRIDESMAIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma stands next to Deborah as she is about to take her vows. PREACHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you, Deborah Burns, take Edward Powell, to be your'-lawfully wedded husband, 'til death do you part? DEBORAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Norma looks over to Arthur, as he sits in the congregatio He is not paying attention to the wedding. He is reading Sartre's play... The CAMERA zooms into a close-up of the page describing t final scene in the play No Exit:

ESTELLE: [with a peal of laughter]: Forever. My God, how funny! Forever. GARCIN: [looks over at the two women, and joins in the laughter]: For ever, and ever, and ever. INSERT: Arthur's eyes... reading...

dialogues.speaker: PAGE
dialogues.text: [They slump onto their respective sofas. A long silence. Their laughter dies away and they gaze at each other.] GARCIN: Well, well, let's get on with it... CURTAIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WEDDING PARTY comes pouring out of the church. There massive LAWN south of the entrance. During the holidays i filled with CHRISTMAS TREES for sale, and dozens of ARTS CRAFTS BOOTHS assembled in rows. The CAMERA moves through the crowd to find Norma posing f photos with her fellow bridesmaids out in front of the square. ACROSS THE SQUARE... Bud Wall lurks within the rows of Christmas Trees. He spies Arthur and Walter mingling with parents and Senator Powell, who has TWO SECRET SERVICEMEN standing close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA approaches the driveway of the VIRGINIA HOUSE. which is positioned at the south end of Forest Lawn squar Wedding guests are arriving in droves. The house is a large GOTHIC MANSION that is often rented for public events... and in this case... for the lavish WEDDING RECEPTION of Deborah Burns and Edward Powell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma move through the courtyard into the wedd reception area... which flows through several TENTS that been erected with HEAT LAMPS and tables covered in WHITE TABLECLOTHS and FLORAL ARRANGEMENTS. Arthur carries the copy of No Exit with him.
ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The play tells the story of uhree people, condemned to hell. They are to remain in a second empire drawing room for all of eternity. He closes the book... his mind dissecting what he has jus read. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They soon discover that their eyelids are missing... and for all eternity they will be unable to sleep. Norma remembers most of the play from high school. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no mirrors... so they will never be able to see their own reflection... but only the faces of their tormentors. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sartre's vision of hell. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Hell... is other people. The look into one another's eyes... Norma sees a WAITER p by with a tray of CHAMPAGNE. They both take a glass. Jim crosses the lawn to greet them. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur... can I speak with you privately for a moment? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Arthur walks away with Jim toward the edge of a PATIO tha overlooks the whole party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Arthur stand at a table. Jim has several PHOTOGRA laid out on the table. They are mostly family photos take from the house of Robert Bevilacqua. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you know this fella? Robert Bevilacqua?
ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I know him. He works at NASA. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know his wife? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... he shot and killed his wife yesterday morning. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... He shot her point blank in the chest in his kitchen. Arthur takes a deep breath. He isn't feeling well. JIM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Bevilacqua fella... if he tries to contact you or Norma... you have to call me immediately, you understand? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course. Arthur looks down at the lawn. Norma is staring back at t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma is now standing up on stage with a MICROPHONE in he hand..,. giving her MAID OF HONOR speech. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little sister once asked me... what's the best thing about being married? Norma looks across the lawn to the table where Arthur is seated, next to Walter and their parents. NORMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her that... it's knowing that for the rest of your life you'll never feel alone. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not ever again. She smiles at her husband.
NORMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is... until you get divorced. There is laughter from the crowd. Deborah blushes... lean her head on her new husband's shoulder. NORMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or... until he decides to kill you. More laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma are now slow dancing. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you say that? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your speech. That joke about me killing you. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I thought it was funny. Guess I've had too much champagne. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your dad tell you about Robert Bevilacqua? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shot his wife yesterday morning. Did you know his wife? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Norma is still searching for some other explanation. NORMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's all a test for the aspiring astronauts? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?
NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A psychological test. They want to see how you'll respond to a moral dilemma... the fate of a human life... determined by the push of a single button. Think of the men on the Apollo thirteen mission... sound familiar? They turn slowly on the dance floor... Arthur closes his eyes... his mind racing... A VOICE breaks through the music...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: May I cut in? Arthur and Norma turn to see a MAN standing there... It is DR. EARL STUPE. STUPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to dance with your wife. Do you mind? Arthur glares at Dr. Stupe. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay Arthur... Arthur looks at him... then back at Norma. His face has g pale and he looks for a moment as though he might faint o the dance floor. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: I.. I.
dialogues.text: (SWALLOWS HARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please excuse me? Arthur moves toward the stairs that lead up to the palati estate. Walter is there... waiting. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! What's going on? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.. I'm gonna be sick Walter... He places his hand on his son's head for a brief moment a then stumbles up the stairs. ON THE DANCE FLOOR... Norma is now slow dancing with Dr. Stupe.
STUPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what they call me. Dr. Stupid. My patients... the ones who will still see me... they find out what I did and they stop calling. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for that. I can't control what people say. STUPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Dr. Stupid now. Someone wrote it on my windshield with soap once. I figure it must have been a relative... a friend of yours. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... how they love you, Norma Lewis. And they love your husband... the one who saved you. Did he save your life? Did he rescue you from the oblivion that I manufactured? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You have my forgiveness, Earl. People make mistakes... and if they seek forgiveness... they should be forgiven. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the rule of my lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur comes into the MEN'S BATHROOM and rushes into one the stalls. He falls to his knees... leaning over the toi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE DANCE FLOOR... Norma notices her brother NATHAN... sitting alone at his table in his wheelchair. He is drunk lost in his own sadness. He smiles at her... STUPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is that old cliche... that the lord works in mysterious ways. Well... I have met the lord. I have spoken to him in my dreams. And it brought me back to that day in my office when you arrived with a fractured foot... some thirteen years ago. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me that it was essential... (MORE)
STUPE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an essential event in the cycle of purgatory and its inevitable conclusion. Norma pulls away from him. Blood drains out of his nose.. STUPE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For when the cycle of purgatory concludes... there is nothing left but a barren wasteland of rock and sand... a deafening wind and a cold, dry winter. ABOVE... on the MARBLE RAILING... the OWL is perched on t ledge... watching... ON THE DANCE FLOOR... Stupe retrieves a PISTOL from his pocket... and raises his eyes to meet those of his dance partner. STUPE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry my dear... Stupe takes the pistol... places it against his temple... pulls the trigger. BLOOD SPRAYS across the dance floor... some of it on Norm face. PEOPLE BEGIN TO SCREAM AND THE ENTIRE WEDDING ERUPT INTO CHAOS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur is now standing at the urinal. He begins to hear commotion outside. He turns his head to the left... when something COLD and METAL locks itself around his wrist. Arthur turns back to the right and sees that it is Robert Bevilacqua. He is standing at the urinal next to him and are now HAND-CUFFED TOGETHER at the wrists. Bevilacqua retrieves a GUN from his pocket at points it a Arthur. He has dark circles under his eyes. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can still save yourself. It's too late for me... but you can still save yourself. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua... BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me out through the kitchen. I have a truck waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Bevilacqua emerge from the men's bathroom into hallway that leads into the kitchen. Beyond them... in th PARLOR... there is commotion among the members of the wed party in response to the gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Bevilacqua move through the kitchen. The WAITE and WAITRESSES are all distracted by the commotion and ba take notice of them as they pass through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter walks down the driveway as several POLICE OFFICERS rush past him, moving toward the entrance of the house. T whole place is being evacuated... He looks toward the square... and begins to move in that direction. The CAMERA drifts back toward the ROCK PILLAR that stands the entrance to the house. Arlington is standing there in front of it. He is wearing his black hat... pulled down l He begins to follow Walter toward the square...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Bevilacqua come out the back entrance into the driveway. There is a WHITE PICKUP TRUCK parked there. Bevilacqua opens the passenger side door and the two of t slide across the seat, Bevilacqua behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter wanders through a group of CHRISTMAS CAROLERS... moving toward the maze of CHRISTMAS TREES. He looks over shoulder... where Arlington emerges from a crowd... stari him down like a monster. Walter's face is ghost white with terror. He begins to wa faster through the maze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma comes down the driveway with her mother and sister. overcome with shock... searching the crowd... NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua puts the truck into drive and speeds out of th driveway onto the street. Jim stands across the lawn, manning the chaos. He recogni the two men as the pass him by... and he raises his WALKI TALKIE to his mouth. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just spotted Bevilacqua... he's in a white pick-up truck. Potential hostage situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter winds his way through the maze of Christmas trees. rounding a corner... where he runs into DANA. DANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter... WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Bud arrives next to her. DANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything alright? WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us. She takes his hand and they move north back toward the church.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 1-95
dialogues.text: The WHITE PICK-UP drives south down 1-95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua has his hands on the steering wheel... Arthur' left arm extended due to the hand-cuffing. BEVILACQUA (DELIRIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you push the button... or was it your wife? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... me too. I wasn't even home. She decided to push it when I wasn't around to stop her. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now she's dead. Did you kill her? BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me? Bevilacqua retrieves a NASA DOSSIER from the dashboard an hands it to Arthur. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenneth Weller. You know him? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name sounds familiar. Does he work at Langley too? BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. He's next. Him and his wife... they've got the box now. Suddenly... BLUE AND RED LIGHTS appear behind them... followed by the sound of a SIREN.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 1-95
dialogues.text: TWO POLICE CRUISERS are now tailing the pick-up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bevilacqua steps on the gas... accelerating to outrun the
ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna let them get me... Arthur... we've got to get to Kenneth Weller. We've got to break the chain... or your wife is gonna die! ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she going to die? BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to kill her! Bevilacqua swerves into the ONCOMING TRAFFIC LANE to pass car in front of them. A LARGE 18-WHEELER TRUCK is barreli toward them. Bevilacqua pulls the truck back into the right lane.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 1-95
dialogues.text: The 18 WHEELER slams on the brakes... then jack-knives to the left... blocking both lanes... One of the POLICE CRUISERS pulls off into the ditch... wh the second CRUISER swerves and SMASHES head on into the s of the truck bed... sheering the top of the sedan into tw pieces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur looks back over his shoulder... seeing the cars sm together. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! You're gonna get us killed! BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Steward take you to the library? Did you meet his mother... the librarian? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she tell you about Prometheus? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...
BEVILACQUA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steward has a twin brother... and he works for the CIA. UP AHEAD... Arthur sees FOUR MORE POLICE CRUISERS with th lights flashing. They have formed a ROADBLOCK. Bevilacqua lowers his foot onto the accelerator... refusi to back down. BEVILACQUA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is purgatory... we're living in purgatory...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 1-95
dialogues.text: The WHITE TRUCK smashes through the line of POLICE CRUISE as POLICE OFFICERS dive for cover. An officer raises his GUN and fires off several rounds to the truck. A BULLET explodes the right front tire... The truck swerves and FLIPS OVER onto one side... tumblin over and over along the interstate in a horrific crash. ONCOMING CARS swerve into ditches... and the white truck comes sliding to a stop on the wet pavement. The CAMERA slowly approaches the smoking wreckage... catc a glimpse of Bevilacqua... his face covered in blood. Art remains hidden from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma rushes down the sidewalk on the perimeter of the square... searching for her son. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter? A BLACK SEDAN pulls up next to her... and Reston steps ou the car. Norma locks eyes with him... recognizing his face... RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lewis? Norma Lewis? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.
RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Reston Steward. I work for the CIA. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Where is my son? Where is my husband? RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... get into the car. Norma stares at him in disbelief... as he opens the back and gestures inside. RESTON (CONT'D) (GENTLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... there isn't much time.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 1-95
dialogues.text: Jim Burns walks through the aftermath of the crash site. There are now several FIRE TRUCKS, AMBULANCES and other EMERGENCY VEHICLES scattered on either side of the interstate. Robert Bevilacqua's DEAD BODY is now on a stretcher. Jim looks down at him briefly... then turns to another OFFICE the scene. JIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Arthur? OFFICER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took him away in an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits up in the back of the ambulance. He has a sma scrape on his cheekbone... but otherwise appears unharmed An EMS TECHNICIAN is in there with him. He hands Arthur a ICE PACK. EMS TECHNICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... hold this against your forehead. It'll keep your head from swelling. Arthur takes the ice pack and places it against his head. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.
EMS TECHNICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it might have been a miracle. The EMS Technician shakes his head in disbelief. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? EMS TECHNICIAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That car accident. I've never seen someone walk away from an accident like that. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody upstairs is looking out for you, buddy. The door to the ambulance opens. A US ARMY OFFICER appear He steps away from the doors and General Teague emerges f the darkness. TEAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you able to walk, son? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. TEAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please step out of the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur steps out of the ambulance and sees that it is par in front of a HOWARD JOHNSON HOTEL on an exit of 1-95. Th hotel has a DINER attached to it. There are more than a dozen POLICE CARS parked in front, along with..several BLACK SEDANS and MILITARY VEHICLES. Arthur hears the rumble of a HELICOPTER circling the sky above them. Its SEARCHLIGHT sweeps through the forest. In front of the diner entrance... more than a DOZEN MEN operate VIDEO CAMERAS and STILL CAMERAS mounted on tripod all pointed toward the front window of the diner. Teague is standing with Cahill and Reston, along with sev other MILITARY PERSONNEL. Arthur notices Norma as she emerges from a BLACK SEDAN... looks exhausted... delirious. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur!
ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma! She hugs him... neither has slept in two days. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Walter? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Reston steps forward. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother has taken your son... but he assures me that he is alive and well. Reston tries to comfort them with a smile. RESTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a walk with us. Norma and Arthur begin to walk with Reston, Teague and Ca toward the diner entrance. RESTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you familiar with the myth of Prometheus? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the 1940s... when NASA was formed, we began developing, in secret, a project that we dubbed the Prometheus Effect. TEAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Projecting fictional scenarios about how we would respond, if and when we came into contact with an alien intelligence. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the intelligence had hostile intent... or if it began to somehow display proof of its ability to destroy us, we would have a system in place to begin negotiating with it in secret.
TEAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goal of Prometheus is to maintain coexistence with this life- form, and eventually achieve peace with it, so that its power can be harnessed, developed and applied in such a manner that will benefit the human race. Arthur notices that Cahill is holding a folder in his rig hand. CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the night of September 3rd, as the server was downloading images from the Viking camera system that you helped design... we experienced an electrical surge from a bolt of lightning. As they arrive at the entrance to the diner, Cahill shows Arthur a blurry black and white photograph. CAHILL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anomaly in the series of Viking images produced this photograph of the Mars surface. The photo appears to be a ghost-like TRAIL OF WHITE LIGHT streaking across the martian landscape. Teague nods toward the diner window. TEAGUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to... it... and whatever it is... Arthur notices Arlington sitting alone in a booth inside diner... waiting... TEAGUE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ghost... an apparition... a methane compound imbedded in pulse of electricity... CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the human spirit is assigned a specific bandwidth upon conception... twins... would provide it with a dual bandwidth carrier... RESTON (INTERRUPTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It claims to be more than six billion years old.
J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stares at the streak of white light in the photo. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My camera... took this photo... CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've run the data sequence off the server more than a thousand times. Each time... this one photo in the sequence comes out of the dark room just like this. We can't explain why. Arthur hands the photo back to Cahill. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it want? Cahill glances at Teague... who looks to Cahill. CAHILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the same thing that it wanted from Bevilacqua... except that poor boy is no longer around to tell us why he shot his wife. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say to you when you were in the car with him? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about breaking the chain. He wanted to find the next test subject... and prevent them from pushing the button. Cahill is writing diligently on his NOTE PAD. Reston can now feel something taking control of him... he looks to Teague... terrified. He closes his eyes... his body begins to twitch. Teague stares at his friend... realizing what is happenin Reston opens his eyes... now possessed... blood draining his ears. RESTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Teague... it's a pleasure to meet you. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to continue with my experiment... if you don't mind. Reston smiles at the General.
RESTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do not interfere... as I assure you that if you do... there will be dire consequences... Reston then turns to face Arthur and Norma. RESTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is of the essence... and I'd like to invite my guests inside. Reston opens the door to the diner and gestures to Arthur Norma for them to come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur, Norma and Reston make their way down the long ais of the diner, flanked by a row of booths, across from a l LUNCH COUNTER with a metal surface. Arlington sits alone in a booth. He pivots his head aroun face them. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please have a seat. Reston sits down next to his twin brother... Arthur and N sit down across from the twins. Arlington has now locked completely into his brother's spirit... The movement of the two men is in now in PERFECT SYNCHRONICITY, staggered by exactly one second... Reston following Arlington. Arlington's eyes remain closed in deep concentration... Arlington's lips move silently... and Reston repeats them loud. Reston's demeanor is now kind... gentle... almost apologetic for his past behavior. RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be frightened by my manner of communication... but it is becoming more difficult for me to speak, given my body's... condition. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done with our son?
RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get to him in a moment... but first I want you to know that I have a deep respect and admiration you both, and I am very sorry... that you pushed the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud now has Walter laid out on the cement next the edge o the SWIMMING POOL at the shallow end. The boy is unconscious... still dressed in his suit from the wedding From across the pool... Dana is squatting on the end of t DIVING BOARD... watching them. Bud then removes Walter's right shoe and sock... exposing bare foot. He then retrieves a SERRATED HUNTING KNIFE... cuts in the flesh from his BIG TOE across the ball of his foot... drawing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reston closes his eyes for a moment. When he opens them.. tears have begun to form, as though he cannot bear the ne that his brother is forcing him to deliver. RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will now give you a chance to save yourselves... an opportunity for redemption and salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud is now carrying the unconscious Walter in his arms. H steps into the shallow end of the heated pool... and dunk the boy under the surface. BLOOD from the cut on the bottom of his foot drains out i the water like red ink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma closes her eyes... the impending sense of dread building inside of her. RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of your son's five functional senses have been permanently impaired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER... Walter floats with his arms spread wide... WHITE STROBES OF LIGHT FLICKER AROUND HIM. The light stre bear a close resemblance to the image in the -Mars photo. Blood streams out from his foot into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood is now flowing out of Reston's left nostril. Both Arthur and Norma recoil in horror. RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is now blind and deaf. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the rest of his life, he will never hear your voice... or see your face. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Why... RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now presented with two options. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Option one... you enjoy the rest of your lives with the money you have been given, and you learn to live with your son's disability. Reston then reaches into his pocket and retrieves a PISTO He places it on the table next to the box.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then there is option number two. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one bullet in the chamber of this gun. Reston slides the gun across the table in Arthur's direct

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can fire this bullet into your wife's heart... killing her. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the exact moment that her spirit departs the earth, this curse upon your son will be reversed, and both of his impaired senses will instantaneously return to normal.
Arthur looks over at Norma in disbelief... then back at t twins. He cannot fathom how it has now come to this.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON/ARLINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arthur, you will then be arrested and charged with the murder of your wife... and the money will be placed in an interest bearing trust for your son to receive upon his eighteenth birthday. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do it. I, pushed your stupid button. If I deserve to be punished for it... then let me kill myself. Arthur has nothing to do with this. RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but the offer is not negotiable. (TO ARTHUR)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if Norma's fingers so much as touch the weapon at any point from this moment on... the restoration of Walter's sight and sound will be denied. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Arthur has to do it... then I want you to make it look like a suicide. Arthur shouldn't be punished for something that I did. RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... but the terms of the offer are not negotiable. Arthur faces has gone completely white. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there an afterlife? The twins smile cryptically in response to Arthur's quest ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because this is purgatory, right? The earth is purgatory... and you're here to start shutting things down... right? The twins appear impressed with his foresight.
RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find your theory to be quite fascinating. But I must remind you that I am unable to disclose the identity of my employers. Arthur glances out the window at all of the cameras. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I get it. Reston then turns to the window... RESTON/ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone please bring up the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma emerge from the diner in a state of delirium. A SOLDIER pulls up in Arthur's TRANS-AM. He ste out of the car and holds the door open. Teague and Cahill approach... as MEN in dark suits snap hundreds of photographs of the couple. Cahill puts his hand on Arthur's shoulder... searching fo words. Teague glances inside the diner... then back at Arthur. Arthur nods his head slowly... his mind lost... and he li toward the car with Norma at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma sits behind the wheel... allowing Arthur to ride shotgun. He looks weakened by the whole ordeal, and she i afraid he might pass out. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this isn't happening, Norma. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening... She starts the engine... and they drive off. Arthur watches the parking lot full of MEN reflected back them in the side-view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELICOPTER SHOT: The CAMERA flies over 1-95 as Arthur's c travels north toward Richmond. A MILITARY HELICOPTER flie overhead... escorting them on their journey home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur sits shotgun as Norma drives them home. They have riding in silence for quite some time now, having reached level of complete mental and physical exhaustion. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these years... I've given you the impression that Walter was an accident. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... and? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... it wasn't exactly an accident. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped taking the pill when I met you... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I was so afraid of losing you to someone prettier than me. Arthur just stares at her... unsure how to respond. NORMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For that alone... I deserve a bullet in the heart... don't you think? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I don't. She manages a smile. A tear rolls down her cheek as she stares out at the pavement and the endless trees lining either side of the interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur pulls the car up into the driveway. The street is quiet and empty.
They step out of the car. Dana is sitting on the front po waiting for them. She rises to her feet as they approach. DANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did my dad tell you why he loves you, Norma? Norma realizes that she has been involved all along. Bloo drains from her nose. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're an amputee. He says that the soul of an amputee leaks out into the wind... searching for the place where there is no longer flesh and bone. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says that the soul that leaks is the soul that endures. It is the kindest and bravest soul of them all. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is our son? DANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's locked in the upstairs bathroom. I think he just woke up. Dana turns away... and begins to walk down the sidewalk i the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter lays inside the bathtub, soaking wet. He is still wearing his suit from the wedding. He is shivering... loo around... disoriented... His EYE-BALLS are now COMPLETELY WHITE... pupils no longe visible. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone-there?! He begins clawing at the walls... trying to figure out wh he is. WALTER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see!
He climbs out of the bathtub and begins to crawl across t tile floor. He runs into the door... and then reaches up finds the DOORKNOB. It is locked. He begins to bang on the door relentlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma and Arthur come up the stairs and round the corner the hallway. Walter's HAND reaches out through the crack beneath the door. Norma tries to open the door but there is a MASSIVE LOCK installed on it. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter! Norma reaches down and takes her son's hand. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?! Who's there?! NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter! It's mom! Can you hear me?! WALTER

dialogues.speaker: WHO'S THERE
dialogues.text: NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not respond... and begins banging his head agains the door... harder and harder... Thump... thump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response... just his head... slamming against the door repeatedly. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to kick the door down. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could get hurt...
Norma begins to pound back on the door with her fist... a eventually the thumping stops. She begins to hear quiet s from inside the bathroom. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? Who's there? Norma rises to her feet. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come downstairs, Arthur. She takes his left hand... as he clutches Walter's hand i his right. NORMA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur... (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to come downstairs with me... right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUZANNE WELLER (30s) sits on her bed. Her husband KENNETH WELLER (30s) stands at the window. Neither looks like the have slept in a while. Suzanne has the box sitting on the mattress in front of her... the glass dome is open. SUZANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna push it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur and Norma stand across from one another in the kitchen. Arthur holds the GUN in his right hand... and he slowly limps over to his wife and takes her into his arms ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma... NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur... I love you, and I'm so sorry... I'm so sorry that I did this to us... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who told you to push the button... so don't apologize. He looks out through the window at his back yard... likel for the last time.
ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too... and please know... that I regret nothing in this life we've lived together. NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting... counting the days until my Arthur comes to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne Weller smiles at her husband... reaches her finge out and places it on the button. She then presses down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM UPSTAIRS... thump... thump... their son's head bangi against the door... NORMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be harder for you to live than for me to die. Arthur closes his eyes... the noise is excruciating. Ther no time to wait any longer. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get on with it. Arthur kisses her... then steps back... still clutching h hand... raises the gun... and fires off a round into her heart. Norma collapses... Arthur falls with her... breaking her with his arms as they collapse into a heap onto the linol floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzanne looks over at her husband and lets out a deranged giggle. He smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur looks down into his wife's eyes as the life drains from her body. Seconds later... Norma is dead.
BLOOD begins to flow from the exit wound in her back acro the linoleum. Arthur is now covered in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter crawls across the blood-soaked kitchen floor and reaches up to the PHONE that is mounted on the wall. He t his finger and places it in the cradle... dials 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA tracks along a series of CUBICLES at the POLIC STATION in downtown Richmond. An OPERATOR sits at each cubicle... each one female. OPERATOR #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 911 emergency... how may I direct your call? The CAMERA moves in closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur has the phone to his ear... imprints of his wife's blood are smeared on the phone's receiver. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. This is Arthur Lewis at 1560 Monument Avenue. I've just shot my wife... can you please send an ambulance? The Operator begins to ask more questions... but Arthur d not listen. He hangs up the phone. The thumping from upstairs has now subsided. ARTHUR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: He pulls himself to his feet and heads into the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur rounds the corner at the base of the stairs... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur rounds the corner of the upstairs hallway... rushe toward the bathroom door. Walter's hand comes sliding out from beneath the crack in door. Arthur grabs it. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... can you hear me? WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see? Where are you Walter? WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the bathroom... ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see clearly? WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I can see... everything is bright... but I can see. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is bright. Everything is bright Walter... you're gonna be okay, buddy. WALTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay, buddy. That's all that matters. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all that matters, now. Out of the corner of his eye, Arthur notices something at top of the stairs. It is a POLICE OFFICER. He has his gun aimed at Arthur. POLICE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur stares at the officer... frozen... the repercussio of his decision now stare him in the face with a loaded g

dialogues.speaker: PUT YOUR HANDS ON YOUR HEAD
dialogues.text: Arthur obeys... and the cop rushes over and pushes him ov onto his stomach... handcuffing his wrists together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL rings. Suzanne Weller opens the door. Arlington is standing ther with his briefcase... smiling. ARLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Weller... do you have the button unit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CORONER places a BLANKET over Norma's face as the house sealed off by various CRIME SCENE INVESTIGATORS and other police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur is now being escorted by two POLICE OFFICERS to a waiting CRUISER that is parked in front of the house. Jim Burns is standing there with the door open. ARTHUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jim. He stares Arthur down as he is put into the back seat of cruiser. Jim closes the door and goes around to the front the car. Jim gets behind the wheel and starts the engine. Arthur looks back through the window, toward his house. Upstairs in the MASTER BEDROOM WINDOW... Walter is watchi tears streaming down his face. Arthur reaches up with his hands... cuffed together... an tries his best to wave at his son.
ARTHUR (CONT'D) (MOUTHING SILENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I`m sorry... From the window... Walter watches the car pull away from curb. He places his hand on the glass... waving back.
